section.title: Comparative adjectives
section.sectiontitle: When we compare two things we use the comparative adjective + than.
section.text2: This bag is £30. That bag is £25.
section.text2a: This bag is more expensive than that one.
section.sectiontitle2: To make the comparative with most one-syllable adjectives, we use adjective + -er  or + -ier.
section.text3: with most adjectives, e.g. cheap, tall, old
section.text3a: This car is cheaper than that one.
section.text4: with adjectives ending in -y, e.g. busy, easy

section.title: Comparative adjectives
section.sectiontitle: With adjectives ending with consonant + vowel + consonant, we double the final consonant.
section.sectiontitle2: With most adjectives of two syllables or more, we use more + adjective.
section.text3a: Madonna is more famous than her husband.
section.text4: (more than two syllables) expensive comfortable successful
section.text4a: This shop is more expensive than that one.
